alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 11:59AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Lafayette, Acadia, northwestern St. Martin and southeastern St. Landry Parishes through 1230 PM CDT... At 1159 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lottie to near Morse. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Opelousas, Crowley, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Rayne, Carencro, Church Point, Iota, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Mermentau, Evangeline, Sunset, Port Barre, Duson, Henderson, Grand Coteau and Morse. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 69 and 126. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Lafayette; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin
